gurmukhi: cMdR brx su krix sXwm suvrn pUC smwn ]
transliteration: Channdra Baran Su Karan(i) Sayaam Suvaran Poochh Samaan||
translation: (The Sacrificial horse) is of white colour, black ears having golden tail;

gurmukhi: rqn quMg auqMg bwjq au`c s√çwh smwn ]
transliteration: Ratan Toung Outan Baajat Uachch Sravaah Samaan||
translation: With eyes high and wide and lofty neck like Unhchyishravas;

gurmukhi: inrq krq clY Drw pir kwm rUp pRBwie ]
transliteration: Nirat Karat Chalai Dharaa Par(i) Kaam Roop Prabhaae||
translation: He walks on the earth with dancing pose, glorious in beauty like Cupid.

gurmukhi: dyiK dyiK CkY sBY niRp rIiJ ieau niRprwie ]9]150]
transliteration: Dekh(i) Dekh(i) Chhakai Sabhai Nrip Reejh(i) Iu Nripraae||9||150||
translation: On seeing him all the kings are pleased and also (Yudhishtra) the king of king.9.150.

gurmukhi: bIx byx miRdMg bwjq bwsurI surnwie ]
translation: Vina, Ven Mridang, Bansuri and Bheri are being played.

gurmukhi: murj qUr sucMg mMdl cMg bMg snwie ]
transliteration: Muraj Toor Mouchannd Mandal Channd Ban Sanaae||
translation: Innumerable Muj, Toor, Murchang, Mandal, Changbeg and sarnaaee;

gurmukhi: Fol Folk KMjkw fP JwNJ kot bjMq ]
transliteration: Dhol Dholak Khanjkaa Daf Jhaanjh Kot Bajant,
translation: Dhol, Dholak, Khanjari, Daph and Jhaanjh are also being played.

gurmukhi: jMg GuMgrU t`lkw aupjMq rwg AnMq ]10]151]
transliteration: Jan Ghoundaroo Tallkaa Oupjant Raag Anant||10||151||
translation: Big bell and small bells resound and innumerable modes of music are created.10.151.

gurmukhi: Aimq sbd bjMqR Bry hrMq bwj Apwr ]
transliteration: Amit Sabad Bajantra Bhare Harant Baaj Apaar||
translation: Kettledrums when played produce unlimited sound and innumerable horses neigh.

gurmukhi: jwq jaun idswn ko pC lwghI isrdwr ]
transliteration: Jaat Jaoun Disaan Ko Pachh Laag-hisirdaar||
translation: Wherever the horse named Sri Barn goes, the army chiefs follow him.

gurmukhi: jaun bwD qurMg jUJq jIqIAY kir ju`D ]
transliteration: Jaoun Baadh Turan Joojhat Jeeteeai Kar(i) Juddh||
translation: Whosoever chains the horse, they fight with him and conquer him.

gurmukhi: Awn jaun imlY bcY nih mwrIAY kir kRu`D ]11]152]
transliteration: Aan Jaoun Milai Bachai Nah(i) Dareeai Kar(i) Kruddh||11||152||
translation: He who receives them, he is saved, otherwise one who confronts, is violently killed.11.152.
